subject: Photography
title: Aspect Ratios Explained
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Aspect Ratios Explained.

hook.text: 3:2, 4:3, 16:9, 1:1 â€” the shape of your photo changes what fits inside it and how it feels.

buildup.text: Aspect ratio is the relationship between width and height. Different cameras default to different ratios.

discovery.text: 3:2 is the classic 35mm format. 4:3 comes from medium format. 1:1 is the square made famous by Instagram.

twist.text: Cinema uses ultra-wide ratios like 2.39:1. Borrowing these for stills creates a cinematic, epic feeling.

climax.text: Choosing an aspect ratio before shooting changes how you compose. The shape of the canvas shapes the art.

punchline.text: The shape of the frame is the first composition choice.

quiz.question: What aspect ratio is the classic 35mm film format?
